p: (i) Genetic fitness is one of the most controversial areas. This is the idea that ‘fitter’ or more ‘virulent’ strains will outcompete and increase in prevalence and replace the weaker lineages (positive selection) [ 147]. A fitter virus can be seen as one with greater transmission, which is theorised to be related to increase replication in the vector or host and thus more ‘virulent’ [ 158, 159]. Recent work supports this showing that more virulent South East Asian DENV2 strains outcompete less virulent strains in mosquitoes co-infected with both [ 160].
